CITY COUNCIL
REGULAR MEETING
OCTOBER 7, 2019
5:30 PM
SULLIVAN CHAMBER

~FINAL ACTIONS~
MEETING

Monday, October 7, 2019

TIME

5:30 PM

PRESIDING OFFICER

Mayor Marc C. McGovern

Dennis J. Carlone

Oct 7, 2019

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appointment
of the following persons as new members of the Cambridge Commission for Persons with Disabilities
Advisory Board, for a term of three years, effective October 7, 2019: Loring Brinckerhoff, Avril de
Pagter, Mary Devlin, Jackie Jones and Daniel Stubbs
CMA 2019 #258
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

2. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to a Planning Board
recommendation not to adopt the City Council zoning petition to amend Article 19.000 of the Zoning
Ordinance regarding utility and infrastructure impacts of large development projects that require a
Project Review Special Permit.
CMA 2019 #259
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE PETITION 9-0-0

3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 19-101, regarding community outreach and participation of residents, especially lowincome households, in Cambridge Energy Alliance (CEA) programs and services.
CMA 2019 #260
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE 9-0-0

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 19-42, regarding sidewalk markings for mobility devices.
CMA 2019 #261
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE 9-0-0

5. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 19-46, regarding whether the MBTA is in compliance with the amended Settlement
Agreement in the District of Massachusetts case Daniels-Finegold et al. v. Massachusetts Bay
Transportation Authority.
CMA 2019 #262
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE 9-0-0

6. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the votes
necessary to seek approval from the Massachusetts Department of Revenue of the tax rate for
FY2020.
CMA 2019 #263
RESULT:
REFERRED TO PUBLIC HEARING

PAGE 2

Oct 7, 2019

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. That the Executive Assistant to the City Council confer with the Dedication Committee to
consider a request from Peter C. Johnson for a street sign dedication to Asa Brebner for his
contributions to the community of Cambridge musicians.
POR 2019 #308
Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

2. That the Executive Assistant to the City Council confer with the Dedication Committee to
consider the request from Vice Mayor Devereux for a street sign dedication near 360 Huron
Avenue in honor of Fresh Pond Market and the Najarian family.
POR 2019 #309
Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

3. That the City Manager is requested to work with the City Clerk’s Office, the Public Information
Office, and the Information Technology Department to identify a suitable location on the City
website to house information regarding the Municipal Code and to track non-zoning legislation
and amendments.
POR 2019 #310
Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Siddiqui
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY 9/23/2019
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 3

Oct 7, 2019

4. That the City Council requests that the City Manager to work with the appropriate City
departments to determine if ISD can be given the authority to issue citations for smoking in nonsmoking buildings and to report back to the City Council
POR 2019 #311
Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

5. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to address the previously requested
investigation of the possibility of entering into an agreement with TransCanada to obtain up to
100% renewable power for all municipal electricity needs
POR 2019 #312
Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

6. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to work with the appropriate City departments
to determine whether it would be possible to allow a permitted area for serving alcoholic
beverages on Danehy Park property during special community-wide events
POR 2019 #313
Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

7. That the City Manager is requested to work with the appropriate departments to ensure that the
redesign of the Harvard Square plaza and its coming renovation be used as an opportunity to
further improve the safety of all crossings in the surrounding area.
POR 2019 #314
Vice Mayor Devereux, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 4

Oct 7, 2019

8. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Department of Human Services and the
Cambridge Public Library system to hire a social worker in the FY2021 budget for the Central
Square Library branch.
POR 2019 #316
Councillor Mallon, Councillor Siddiqui, Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

9. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Peace Commission and Citizens’
Commission on Civic Unity to ensure that the Meet Your Neighbor Day event is held at another
time of year, in Spring or Summer, in order to eliminate any appearances of political conflict at
Meet Your Neighbor Day events.
POR 2019 #317
Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
ORDER WITHDRAWN [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
10. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to proposed
amendments to the following ordinance: and proposed amendments to Chapter 14.04 of the
Cambridge Municipal Code (the "Fair Housing Ordinance). Fair Housing (passed to a 2nd
reading) AWAITING HOME RULE LEGISLATION-BEFORE PROPOSAL CAN BE
ORDAINED
CMA 2018 #234
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 10/21/2019 5:30 PM

11. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting
Report Item Number 18-108, regarding a report on offering early voting in City Council and
School Committee Elections. PENDING RESPONSE FROM LEGISLATURE
CMA 2018 #286
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 5

Next: 10/21/2019 5:30 PM

Oct 7, 2019

12. A Zoning Petition has been received from Alexandria Real Estate Equities, Inc. et al proposing a
Grand Junction Pathway Overlay District
APP 2019 #75
RESULT:
PLACED ON TABLE

13. Limb Girdle Muscular Dystrophy Awareness Day
POR 2019 #318
Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 6

Oct 7, 2019

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. An application was received from Amorino Gelato JFK, LLC, requesting permission for a sandwich
A-Frame sign in front of the premises numbered 50 JFK Street between September 6, 2019 thru
March 31, 2020 with a start time of 11:00am and end time of 12:00am.
APP 2019 #76
RESULT:
FAILED OF ADOPTION 2-6-0-1

2. An application was received from &Pizza, requesting permission for a sandwich board sign in front
of the premises numbered 3 Brattle Street with a start date of December 1, 2019 thru March 31, 2020
and a start time of 11:00am and a end time of 11:00pm.
APP 2019 #77
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT
Next: 10/21/2019 5:30 PM

3. An application was received from the Department of Community Development requesting permission
for a temporary banner across JFK at Mount Auburn Streets announcing Cambridge Energy Alliance
on October 8, 2019 through October 31, 2019.
APP 2019 #78
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED 9-0-0

4. An application was received from MIT Visual Arts Center requesting permission for fifteen
temporary banners on Ames Street, Memorial Drive to Main Street, announcing Alicja Kwade: In
Between Glances on October 7, 2019 and removal date of January 31, 2019.
APP 2019 #79
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED 9-0-0

5. A Zoning Petition Has been received from Suzanne P. Blier regarding Harvard Square Zoning
Petition.
APP 2019 #80
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE ORDINANCE COMMITTEE AND PLANNING BOARD
FOR HEARING AND REPORT 9-0-0
Next: 12/11/2019 5:30 PM

PAGE 7

Oct 7, 2019

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Traffic, Parking and Transportation
Department, the Harvard Square Business Association and the Harvard Square Neighborhood
Association to determine the feasibility of closing some portion of Harvard Square to vehicular traffic
on a select number of days during the summer of 2020 to have open market-style events.
POR 2019 #321
Councillor Mallon, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

2. Recognizing LGBTQ+ History Month
POR 2019 #322
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

3. That the full City Council ask the City Solicitor to report back on the legal authority of the City to ban
the use of natural gas in newly constructed buildings.
POR 2019 #323
Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

ABSENT:

Councillor Simmons

4. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to direct the Arts Council and the Department of
Public Works, in conjunction with the Rindge School of Technical Arts, to determine the best re-use
for the four honey locust logs from Inman Square to create public art for the community.
POR 2019 #324
Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan
BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS


PAGE 19

Oct 7, 2019

5. That the City Manager have appropriate city staff review the proposed Welcoming Community
Ordinance
POR 2019 #325
Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Carlone, Councillor
Zondervan, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [UNANIMOUS]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

6. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to provide an update to the City Council on the
number of free MBTA passes issued to CRLS students in FY20 and to consider expanding the
program to include qualifying Cambridge residents of high school age
POR 2019 #326
Vice Mayor Devereux, Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

7. Fuel pump warning labels
POR 2019 #327
Vice Mayor Devereux, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [7-2-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Mallon, Mayor McGovern,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

NAYS:
Councillor Kelley, Councillor Simmons

8. Public Utilities' Planning and public meetings
POR 2019 #328
Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 20

Oct 7, 2019

9. That the Cambridge City Council go on record stating its severe concern for the developments in
Kashmir and declaring its solidarity with the Kashmiri people, specifically Cambridge’s Kashmiri
community, that they may soon again be in contact with their families, friends and loved ones.
POR 2019 #329
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

10. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Electrical Department to ensure that City Hall is
appropriately illuminated in honor of Indigenous Peoples Day and Hispanic Heritage Month on
Friday, October 18, from the hours of 6:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m.
POR 2019 #330
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Mallon, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

11. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to allocate more funds in the FY21 budget to
Inspectional Services to help combat the city-wide rodent issue and report back on the feasibility of
providing monetary compensation to homeowners who have had to self-finance traps and what funds
could be allocated in the future to help homeowners buy traps.
POR 2019 #331
Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey

ABSENT:

Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 21

Oct 7, 2019

12. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to work with relevant City departments and the
Department of Conservation and Recreation to install NO TURN ON RED signs along Memorial
Drive where it intersects with Cambridge-owned streets to improve the safety of heavily used
pedestrian and non-vehicular, multimodal commuter routes along and across the Charles and
increased enforcement by the Massachusetts State Police at these intersections.
POR 2019 #332
Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

13. That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Budget Department, the Assessor's Department
and the Community Development Department to consider directing a portion of future PILOT funds
into the Affordable Housing Trust starting in FY21.
POR 2019 #333
Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

14. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to allocate more funds in the FY21 budget for the
small business improvement grants and to confer with the Massachusetts Attorney General’s office on
whether other cities in Massachusetts have been facing similar issues with ADA compliance and what
can be done to protect the small businesses.
POR 2019 #334
Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 22

Oct 7, 2019

15. That the City Council go on record in support of House Bill 3116, Senate Bill 2034, and the
establishment of Governor Baker’s Low-speed Mobility Device Advisory Working Group as part of
the Safe Driving Legislation, Senate Bill 7
POR 2019 #335
Councillor Kelley, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Mallon, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,

Councillor Zondervan

16. Creating the Director of Arts and Culture Position
POR 2019 #336
Councillor Mallon, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

17. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Economic Development division of the
Community Development Department to retain a financial/economic analyst to conduct a confidential
financial analysis of NED’s pro forma to inform the council in confidence on the value of the
proposed upzoning.
POR 2019 #337
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Kelley, Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXCERCISED BY COUNCILLOR SIMMONS
Next: 10/21/2019 5:30 PM

18. That the City Manager is requested to seek permission from the Department of Conservation and
Recreation to plant new trees in Magazine Beach Park in Spring 2020 with a special focus on the
eastern end of the park and the grove area.
POR 2019 #338
Councillor Zondervan, Vice Mayor Devereux, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Mallon
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 23

Oct 7, 2019

19. That the City Manager is requested to direct the City Solicitor, Community Development, Public
Works, Inspectional Services and any other related departments to review the proposed amendments
regarding the prohibition of Natural Gas Infrastructure in New Buildings.
POR 2019 #339
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Siddiqui, Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

ABSENT:

Councillor Simmons

20. That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Affordable Housing Trust on the matter of
increasing funding to the City’s HomeBridge program so that access to homeownership may be made
available to a wider range of incomes, as the program intends.
POR 2019 #340
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Mallon, Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

21. Proposed amendment to City Ordinance 1.12.040 regarding City Solicitor opinion on proposed
ordinances.
POR 2019 #341
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
RECONSIDERATION FILED BY VICE MAYOR DEVEREUX [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

22. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to confer with the Fire Chief to report back
providing information confirming that the temporary location of the Taylor Square Fire Station to the
Alewife area continues to provide uninterrupted service to residents in the Taylor Square Fire Station
area.
POR 2019 #320
Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

Oct 7, 2019
